Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Fragment of the torso of a young man (?)
Description: The recto side of the plaque shows the torso of a male figure in profile. The hair, which follows the shape of the skull, is marked by a line at the bottom of the brow, cut horizontally to the height of the ear. The eye is formed by a double line at the top and a single at the bottom. The reproduction of the nose, of the mouth and of the ear is very faithful. The chest is left unfinished. The verso side contains a representation of a ram placed in a large frame. It has four horns of which two are found horizontally on the head and the two others that curve on the jaw. Only the outlines of the eye, the muzzle and the ear are indicated. The body and the legs are not detailed.
